Thank you Barb for relaying the message 
(I can either open AIM or Explorer but not both...at the same 
time...I have bad computer karma)

Ofcourse I'm compiling the lineages from SErizawa Kamo's bio and 
other websites, old threads from here and ofcourse my messageboard 
but I was concerned how many guys cross trained in more lineage and I 
was concerned with getting a most complete list as possible....it's 
not because I'm lazy...I just really wanted to get this done sometime 
tomorrow (^_^).

I'm trying to reply to a kind of important email with someone...who 
is very very very knowledgeable about martial arts....hopefully this 
will spark his interest to the point he will delve deeper into 
lineages represented in the Shinsengumi.
--------------------------------------------------
DURING THE SAME TIME PERIOD.....
"Samurai in Salt Lake"  was about stranded nobles/samurai (from what 
little info I have they were pro-shogunate as well but I don't know 
if the person trying to get info can give me more details or not) in 
UTAH...the small book was printed at WEBER STATE UNIVERSITY.  The 
same writer who compiled SAmurai in SAlt Lake wrote a thesis on the 
Shinsengumi and I have yet to get his name and search the library 
database for a copy....waiting...waiting...waiting (-_-)
